website_summaries.verdict: One of the best options for an affordable gaming mouse pad to improve overall performance.
pros: Cloth surface is free from blemishes and defects to promote accurate and smooth mouse tracking
Rubber base will keep the pad in place during heavy gaming use
cons: Not as large as some professional-level gaming pads

website_summaries.verdict: A fine entry model for PC gamers on a budget, especially since its sleek and durable cloth surface was built for longevity and slick mouse control.
pros: Smooth cloth surface promotes smooth mouse gliding
cons: The one caveat of this inexpensive gaming mouse pad is that the edges may feel sharp on your exposed forearm or wrist at first

customer_reviews.title: More of a cat pad than a mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: Overall really good. Has lasted me over 8 months so far. Only complaint would be the edge feels a little sharp until it wears in from my forearm.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Rigolo

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding mouse pad -- where has this been all my life??
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those things where I don't know where it has been all of my life. Full disclosure, I'm not a PC gamer at all -- I simply wanted a nice, wide, smooth surface for my hands, keyboard and mouse. This thing is absolutely fantastic! Honestly, I'm going to give some of them as gifts this year.. that's how much I like it. Nothing fancy, no crazy piping or design on it, just a nice, comfortable surface. Calling this one a big win.
customer_reviews.author: Craig L.

customer_reviews.title: Other better brands, the edges lay flat out of the ...
customer_reviews.text: The edges don't lay flat on the table. Other better brands, the edges lay flat out of the box\. Also, edges are sharp and unfinished so it will irritate your skin - this is also not the case with other brads. Just pay 5 more dollars and get the one by St**lS*ries. If you are moving your arm/mouse a lot (which is what this mouse pad is for), this ought to bother you. Everyone who gave 5 or 4 stars must have very thick skin, or they are not using the mouse pad the way it is supposed to be used, or I just got a bad one.
customer_reviews.author: PhD

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier...
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much. Thought it was time to replace my worn out mouse pad after 20+ years. Basically, I ordered two of the first one that appeared in the search. I couldn't be happier. These are nice and thin, do not slide on my desktop, my mouse responds perfectly. Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: QuitChangingMyProfileName

customer_reviews.title: I fine the smoother surface of the G640 much more comfortable ...
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the Logitech G640, this is a thinner, rougher texture. I fine the smoother surface of the G640 much more comfortable to game on, and the thicker mouse pad more comfortable and high quality feeling. The Amazon pad is a great size, just a bit too rough and thin for my liking. After trying TONS of mouse pads, I would recommend the G640 for $40 or the Steelseries Qck + over this for a similar price.
customer_reviews.author: brock

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Logitec Wireless Laser mouse and a 27" desktop which is a lot of screen for the pointer to cover. This mousepad works great with my set up. Smooth, snag free operation with just the right amount of friction between the mouse and pad. I need a lot of pad real estate with a 27" screen so the standard was a perfect size. recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Baker

customer_reviews.title: Once you go large you will never go back
customer_reviews.text: If you need a larger gaming pad that can easily be folded or sandwiched between a laptop screen and keyboard, the AmazonBasics Gaming Mouse Pad is perfect. Those small mouse pads can simply be tossed, whether you are gaming or doing office work. The top fabric is responsive to my older optical mice and newer laser mice. It feels soft and comfortable against my skin. The bottom rubbery feel backing holds the pad securely to the top of my plastic topped desks. I love the large size -- why did I not get one of these years ago!?
customer_reviews.author: Dan Leithauser

customer_reviews.title: Flat clicker works, doesn't slide, but "Standard" size is way too big
customer_reviews.text: I imagine for 85% of people out there, the "mini" size would actually be perfect. I could cut this Standard size in half, and still not even get 2" to the edges when moving my mouse across my entire iMac screen. Overall, it's a basic item at a dirt cheap cost--so I don't want to be too harsh--which is why I'd still consider it a 5/5 stars, high quality flat clicker. I'm just a little disappointed in myself for not realizing how huge the "standard" size is. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Beau Chevassus

customer_reviews.title: Strong rubber odor; Uneven thickness; poorly cut edge(s)
customer_reviews.text: I purchased extended mouse pad, and I like it overall, but I can smell the rubber way too much. It is very smooth on top, but not completely flat (uneven thickness). The edge has some sharp clingings, that is far more than uncomfortable but irritates my arms. I suppose they laser cut this mouse pad, and sections are melt and dried. I haven't spilled anything yet, but this material is easy to have dust cling onto it. Some updates after couple months of usage: Edge still rough, irritating, Can't smell the old rubber tire like thing unless your nose is touching the mousepad. I would not quite recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: JKim

customer_reviews.title: Like Steelcase, but more economical!
customer_reviews.text: This is a highly responsive mouse mat! I am a graphic designer, so my mouse needs a responsive surface. I bought this to replace an old Steelcase mat I had that had long since worn out, and it works just as well as the Steelcase did when I first purchased that one! It's durable, thick, and very smooth, and I have yet to have any issues! I haven't tried gaming on it yet, but in terms of fine response, it is excellent for my design work!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Lakose

customer_reviews.title: Basic but ahead of the game
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased and have had many a mouse pad over the years. I didn't need anything too crazy - just something that WORKS and the AmazonBasics Gaming Mouse fills that need. It's a great size, the Smooth Cloth Surface works great for all the different types of mice I've tried on it and the Rubberized Base helps keep things in place while I'm working or gaming. Also knowing that its Machine Washable and that I can easily throw it in the washing machine is great. Do I recommend it? Absolutely - its more than basic and adequate and is a great purchase if you are in need of a budget mouse pad option from a brand you can trust.
customer_reviews.author: Derick B

customer_reviews.title: No distractions mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: I hate distractions while I am working, even if they occur at the corner of my eye, so I refuse to use mouse pads with weird patterns, bright colors, prominent corporate logos, or pictures of my cats or offspring. This one covers an entire corner of my desk, and I rotate it so the Amazon logo is in the far right corner, covered with another desktop item. I can then mouse around anywhere to the right of my keyboard and not worry about straying off the mousepad, or being distracted by patterns, colors, or anything else.
customer_reviews.author: David D. Busch

customer_reviews.title: Still smells after two months outside airing
customer_reviews.text: This product is STILL so smelly after two months of airing outside that I cannot use it. It is going in the trash and I ordered the Italian leather one which is very nice. I have had mouse pad that needed outgasing before but usually after a month they are fine. This one's order will not go away. I find it amazing that it is Amazon's choice. Maybe there has been a change in the product but it definitely isn't something that I would advise purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Fay

customer_reviews.title: A Practically Useless Mousepad
customer_reviews.text: I've been very pleased with most Amazon Basics items, but this one misses the mark. - The mouse pad is too thin, causing my Logitech device to not track well on it - After countless adjustments through both Windows and Logitech software, it does not improve performance - It came rolled up in its packaging and the end of pad has never flattened out * Spend a few bucks more and get a regular, thicker one (and save yourself the frustration.)
customer_reviews.author: Seadesire

customer_reviews.title: decent pad for the money
customer_reviews.text: decent pad for the money. A little on the thin side but for the price can be overlooked. I knocked a star down. While its a decent enough pad in the middle. The edges fray and are actually gritty. Like sandpaper. My 80.00 braided mouse cord was getting cut and frayed from move it side to side over the edge of the mouse mat. The fix was to put some black tape on the edge so the mouse cord slides over the tape and not the sharp edge of the pad. So for corded mice I would like elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: There is a slight bump from it being rolled up for so long.
customer_reviews.text: The left edge of my mouse pad has a roll in it as you can see in the pictures. It doesn't bother me a ton but it is slightly annoying. I don't notice it when I'm gaming or on my computer, but it is quite the eye sore. The mouse pad is also relatively large and I never use the entire pad. I'm not a hardcore pc gamer though. Overall it is a great mouse pad and it works well, I just wish there was a roll in it. I tried putting flat heavy things on it but that didn't fix the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: and I love it, I put it under my keyboard and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the full length mouse pad I have ever had, and I love it, I put it under my keyboard and don't have to worry about a separate mouse pad for my mouse, it works wonderful slides real easy and I don't have to worry about my mouse falling off the mouse pad, absolutely love this full length mouse pad, it stays in place and doesn't move around, its made really good, glad I bought this, no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: C. SANFORD

customer_reviews.title: It s a great mousepad
customer_reviews.text: I mean.. it's a mousepad. It's an amazon Basics mousepad. It's the perfect size for the mouse to glide around on. No frills. You can't roll it up and use it as a pillow but as a mousepad, it works great. No slippage or judgy looks from it. Stylish in black and seems to get along well with my current mouse. No fighting, yelling or congress level gridlock. I think it has made me a better gamer but can't really pinpoint the reasons. Overall very happy with this purchase. Now to look for a pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Carlo Costanzo

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a name brand version that was slightly smaller (less deep) when I had a smaller desk. When I purchased a larger desk for my office, I wanted something that allowed me to better use the extra space. I don't like lots of logos and images and what not on them, just wanted a straight black professional pad at a decent price - this fit the bill as the AmazonBasics logo is small -- and could be easily removed if it bothered me.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Northrup

customer_reviews.title: Great Economy Desktop Pad
customer_reviews.text: For the price and the quality this is a great buy. Some people are complaining the edges never flattened down after receiving it in a rolled tube mailer, but this was not the case for me. Mine rested perfectly in a flat position within minutes after unpacking it. [If you find yourself having that problem, maybe try heating it a little with a blowdryer or something]. The pad lies heavy and flat on my desktop, doesn't move around at all while I do a lot of mousing around, and gives me much better reception from my optical laser than the bare desktop did. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly fine mouse pad. Great value.
customer_reviews.text: One of the things I kept seeing in reviews for other mouse pads, was that people would mention the horrible smell that accompanied many of them. So I was kind of expecting that this one too, would need airing out. It didn't. No smell to me whatsoever. It's just a plain old nice mouse pad. Nothing fancy. I don't need more than that. When I game, I use a console, so I can't say anything about using while gaming, but the mouse pad gets the job done in every other aspect.
customer_reviews.author: JaneDoe966Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Mousepad that mice can't see!
customer_reviews.text: Laser mice (read: 95% of mice manufactured in the last 15 years) do not pick up on the surface, making it functionally useless as a mouse pad. If the mouse moved at all, it was jumpy. No issues with my old, torn up, $5 old-school mousepad, nor issues with my desk directly. Just wanted a nice jarge mat. I am unsure how this has so many positive reviews when the product, simple as it is, fails at its one function.
customer_reviews.author: Chris the Tech

customer_reviews.title: Fibers get caught on my G502 and throw off my aim--avoid!
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 mouse pads, and this is the only pad I have problems with. The fibers somehow get caught a bit at times on my G502 mouse when moving it. It's subtle, but I can feel it and it's definitely enough to throw off my aim. I have tried a lint roller to ensure it isn't hair or anything and after switching back to my other pads and having no issues with them, I am convinced it is the fault of this pad. It may look and feel great at first but after a few weeks or months you may notice the same problem. Pick something else!
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: A little bigger than I thought, great purchase
customer_reviews.text: It was a little bigger than I actually thought it would be, but it worked out perfectly. I’ve bought so many cheep mousepads that just don’t feel nice and the mouse doesn’t drag smoothly across the pad- this is not one of those crappy pads. I’m honestly stunned that you have such nice quality for the price you pay. The mouse slides effortless over the pad and it doesn’t slide all over my desk when my games get a little frantic and heated. I’ll totally buy this again if I need another one in the future. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Eliza D.

customer_reviews.title: Bought for "just mouse pad use" ...and works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: These are great for standard mouse pad needs. I'm not a gamer, so I didn't evaluate them for that purpose, but they seem well-suited for any mousing needs. I like that they are rolled up, so you can easily put a few spares into your supplies cabinet and anyone needing a mouse pad can take one. I tested these with a wide variety of optical and mice with roller balls. All worked well with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Wehrli

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be reasonably well made. However, for some reason one corner is beginning to fold upwards. While I have not had any problems with respect to durability, I doubt that this pad could withstand the treatment that hard surface mouse pads will handle. I think it is actually surprisingly easy to clean. Most of the time you can just brush it off with your hand. If it seems to be really grubby then a damp cloth has done the job. So far, I have not used any cleaning compounds on it.
customer_reviews.author: bleach

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, poor execution
customer_reviews.text: Amazon really struck out on this one. The size and design is great but the fact they made this without a braided edge makes no sense. It takes about 30 mins of use to understand that edges to this are just terrible. They irrigate the skin and start to fray after any sort of real use. Think of it like a cheaply made mouse pad that your local computer shop tosses in the bag when you buy something signification. Don't waste your time/money, look for an XXL pad with good edges in the same price point.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel B.

customer_reviews.title: Huge, luscious mousepad
customer_reviews.text: This mousepad is HUGE! Actually, a bigger than I had anticipated, but that was my fault - I didn't estimate the size correctly. It takes up a solid third of my medium-sized desk, but I have no complaints. I am able to use my mouse smoothly no matter how I am seated. It grips the surface of the desk nicely and feels like it should last for years to come. I had used my mouse without a pad for years before this, but finally broke down after enough wearing down of my desk surface and the mouse feet. Now my mouse moves smoothly and feels faster/more accurate over using the desk surface.
customer_reviews.author: Devin Morton

customer_reviews.title: It's a Mousepad
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what you would expect from a mousepad...sits there and lets you move a mouse around on it. Only issue is that it is shipped rolled up, and I am still waiting for one edge (was the center of the roll) to flatten out. It's been months, beginning to lose hope that it'll ever lay perfectly flat. But the other 98% of it is flat, and it is plenty big that I don't even need to use that curled edge.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa R. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Contrary to what the description, this is NOT a thick pad.
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to what the description says, this is NOT a thick pad by any means. Pretty flimsy and thin at about 2mm whereas your average mouse pad is about 4-6mm. The top texture is nice and should serve it's purpose but I'm not using it as a mouse pad. It came rolled up in a box so you have to slow some time for it to flatten out completely. I just got mine so don't know how long that will be. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: john merritt

customer_reviews.title: Works with Logitech G502
customer_reviews.text: I use my Logitech G502 gaming mouse and Logitech MX Vertical mouse on this pad. They have no problem tracking on the pad. I used to have a hard mouse pad that basically acted as sandpaper and ground away at the pads underneath my mouse and I had a bad experience with my mice not reading on cloth pads, but I figured this mouse pad was really affordable and made for gaming and people basically only game with laser mice so I gave it a shot. Luckily it works just fine and my little pads will be saved as well.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: What's not to like?
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a SteelSeries gaming pad for several years but the edges are curling up. As SteelSeries gaming pads are normally 2-3 times the price of this pad, I decided to give one a try. I have to say this is an awesome gaming/mouse pad and compares extremely well with the SteelSeries pad. I am so impressed I just ordered 2 more. You can't go wrong with this and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: This mousepad is a good size, and the non-slip material on the back does a great job on my desk of keeping it from sliding around. The material on the top has improved the tracking on the mouse. However, after less than a week of moderate, the fabric on the top of the mousepad has started to peel away from the foam. I can't see this mousepad lasting more than another week or two before it will need to be replaced at this rate.
customer_reviews.author: Matt A.

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: This product was larger than I expected. The surface is nice and smooth for quick and easy actions. It does it's job pretty well. My only complaint is that the underside isn't very grippy. Through a three hour Counter Strike session I have to move the mat back into it's original spot as it'll slide half way off my desk. Overall very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Sydorowicz

customer_reviews.title: Ever had your optical mouse fail to work on a table?
customer_reviews.text: I travel frequently for work and have often ended up in situations where my optical mouse does not work on whatever surface my laptop is on (shiny conference room table, glass surface, etc.). I bought this to keep in my backpack for just those situations, and it handles it perfectly. It's significantly thinner than a traditional mouse pad and is almost unnoticeable in the laptop area of my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Esau

customer_reviews.title: Good size for a smaller desk
customer_reviews.text: My previous mousepad was too small, so my hand kept veering off of it while gaming. This one replaced it and I don't have that problem anymore (I bought the...well, I forget what the official measurement is, but looking at it now, I'm guessing it's 12" by 10". It's not absurdly long. I don't know why they make mousepads that are two feet long when most of it just ends up sitting under your keyboard. Why do keyboards need to sit on mousepads? They don't. I've had this one for about two months now, and with daily use it still doesn't have curling or frayed edges. Still nice and flat.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Soooo Sleek and Sexy!
customer_reviews.text: Why did I wait so long? Until now I've been mousing on an old cardboard box. And losing every game. This smooth sleek gaming mouse pad is exactly what I needed to take my performance up a notch. Whether you are playing Doom 2 or cracking numbers with Lotus 1,2,3 you won't regret having a mouse pad. I know I'll never run my mouse up and down my thigh again... well I might. But not when the computer's on that's for sure. This pad rocks.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: It's a LARGER than normal mousepad FYI
customer_reviews.text: I don't do gaming and bought this rather quickly without really reading the description or paying attention to the dimensions. It's a big mousepad. So large that I actually was a little annoyed with it at first on my very small desk. But I got used to it. It's a good mousepad, nice and thin, and works as expected. Just be aware (as I was not) that it is larger than standard. :)
customer_reviews.author: bettylion

customer_reviews.title: Massive
customer_reviews.text: This thing is massive and I love it! My husband makes fun of me all the time for it and I've lovingly nicknamed it "Big Bertha." When I play MOBA's, I move my mouse all over the place, so having something that will cover the table no matter what kind of crazy thing I do is really nice! The edges are a bit rough, almost like the glue holding it together kind of squished out and it makes it uncomfortable if your arm rests on the pad, but it's not a big issue.
customer_reviews.author: Alex M.

customer_reviews.title: Much larger than my old one
customer_reviews.text: As you can see in the photo, the new black one is much larger than the old blue one. The blue one would be considered by most as a standard mouse pad and probably sufficient for most Windows machines, but if you have a big 27 in iMac and a second monitor, like me, the extra area is greatly appreciated. The pad is thin, smooth on top, and works great. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with M500 Logitech Mouse
customer_reviews.text: My Logitech M500 mouse won't track with the pad. It works on other mouse pads, and the top of the work-desk. Pad seems like nice quality though. Too bad. *Update: The mouse pad works with my Logitech M705. Upon farther testing, my M500 mouse doesn't work on any other surfaces (Notepads, paper, or other various surfaces), and must be getting old & cranky. 5*s, does it's job.
customer_reviews.author: Trey Boles

customer_reviews.title: Sharp edges
customer_reviews.text: Recently bought a new pc for gaming and needed a decent mouse pad. I have purchased amazon basics brand in the past and have been satisfied with the quality. For the price it will get the job done but the edges of the mouse pad are sharp and unfinished (think nylon that has been burnt to keep it from fraying) for shorter gaming sessions it will work fine but if you plan on playing for extended periods of time I would wear a long sleeve.
customer_reviews.author: T. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Others have said much the same thing; it's hard to screw up a mouse pad, but this one is complete junk and a wast of money. The edges are sharp and will irritate any part of your skin that makes contact with them. The only way to make mine usable was to take a pair of scissors and cut all the way around the perimeter of the pad; leaving me with a usable pad with completely ragged edges. Don't bother with this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: sillicon 28

customer_reviews.title: I use pieces of it on many different 'puters
customer_reviews.text: II have more PCs than I sometimes know what to do with, and each has an optical mouse that needs a matte black mousepad. Not a big one, maybe 6"x8"...I am not a gamer, not even board games or cards let along 'puter games. But these little patches cut off the large one, work really really well. On my lap. On the arm of a chair. Anywhere. Hellova deal, too!
customer_reviews.author: Mac Townsend

customer_reviews.title: Won't lay flat
customer_reviews.text: This thing comes rolled up, looked cool at first and have had other mouse pads come rolled up, however on the standard size the its so thin it won't lay flat, had a book on it all night but still has the same edge curl, read other 1 star reviews and seems a common them, wife said try her hair dryer with no luck, not a good mouse pad if it can't lay flat.
customer_reviews.author: QueadlunnRau

customer_reviews.title: Avoid if you have pets.
customer_reviews.text: At first I really liked this mouse pad, I ordered the largest one and was very pleased. But, I have a dog, and there is something about the texture of the fabric that holds onto pet hair. I can't just brush it off with my hand, that doesn't work. I can't even use a lint roller, that doesn't work either. I literally have to rub it with tape to remove the embedded hairs. It's driving me crazy.
customer_reviews.author: 54Yoshis

customer_reviews.title: Overall Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: The mouse pad is extremely impressive considering its price. The only thing I don't like is that its too smooth, wo when you move your mouse it goes pretty fast, and pretty hard to control. The material is great and smooth. It also doesn't flatten out when you receive it because it's being rolled up. But other than that, everything else is great. It's pretty big too
customer_reviews.author: Andy Zhu

customer_reviews.title: The edges are VERY rough
customer_reviews.text: I want to love this mouse pad, the size of it is perfect. However, the rest of the pad leaves a lot to be desired. The material itself feels soft but will actually snag on your arm hair. The edges of the mouse pad are unfinished and it feel like rough cardboard edge as your arm moves across it. Definitely returning for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Rachie

customer_reviews.title: Edges Fraying
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 8 months ago. The edges have started fraying and hardening. Each edge has become abrasive to my wrist. The rubber has hardened it almost feels like it could scratch my skin if I moved the mouse too quickly. It worked okay for about 6 months, but now the rubber is getting old and hard. It is not comfortable any more. I would expect a mouse pad to last more than a year, but this one did not.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Burch

customer_reviews.title: Insanely Huge
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this I assumed that a 'gaming mousepad' was like a normal mousepad but with like different material to be better for gamers. And it is the same as a regular mousepad, but huge. I probably should have read the size before I bought it but I didn't and now I have a huge mousepad for my office. That's ok though because it's actually great to be able to move my mouse around without lifting it and replacing it because it was falling off a mousepad.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor B.

customer_reviews.title: The razor sharp edges will hurt your skin!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely agree with what some are saying about the hard edge irritating your skin. They must’ve cut these things with plasma cutters or something. I’ve only had it for one day, and I’m considering returning it for this very reason. My wrists and forearms are raw and scratchy from pad. I’ve had others in the past that had a border around them, which seems to solve this issue. Someone mentioned wrapping it in tape, but I don’t see the need to spend more money on this when it’s already around the same price as the better ones.
customer_reviews.author: C. Self

customer_reviews.title: Totally useless, curser will not track
customer_reviews.text: Amazon Basics standard size gaming mouse pad - I have no clue how they can sell this as a mouse pad, it doesn't work. I tried it sitting on different surfaces, with it turned upside down, everything I could think of, and the curser would not track properly on the screen. Heck, the back of my hand worked much better than this mouse pad. Am using a wireless HP optical mouse, nothing out of the ordinary. ???? Very frustrating when something like this turns out to be useless.
customer_reviews.author: D. W. Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this gaming mouse pad because I saw I was about half the price of other ones. And when I came in I was actually surprised it was really good quality mouse pad. Plus I liked it it was delivered prime so I got it right away but hopefully it holds up for a while I don’t expect it to last too long since I’ve planned to use it a lot for gaming !
customer_reviews.author: Sherry&David

customer_reviews.title: Big enough to use as a wrist rest.  Sticky on bottom so it doesn't move. WIN!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I hadn't had a mouse pad in years, but I think I really needed one. Got the standard size. I like the larger pad because it lets me rest my wrist on the pad itself and reduces fatigue if I'm using the mouse for extended periods. It's cheap enough that I can get another one down the road if this one gets torn up or soiled. The bottom is sticky so it doesn't shift around on the table.
customer_reviews.author: L. Shuler

customer_reviews.title: XXL Mouse Pad
customer_reviews.text: Great mouse/keyboard pad, easy to use and the LED feature provides 14 different LED colors at the touch of a button. Wide enough for both your keyboard and mouse on either side. Arrived on-time and well packaged. Plug into any available USB port (I used the one on my monitor) and select the color or no color if desired and away you go.
customer_reviews.author: Rover100

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size, improved tracking
customer_reviews.text: Tracks much better than my old plastic pad. Large size means I don't have to lift when traversing both screens of my work computer. Construction is fine and the rubberized back is nice and grippy, so it doesn't move at all. Feels identical to a branded "gaming" mouse pad I use at home, but was substantially less.
customer_reviews.author: Smitty

customer_reviews.title: I'm not a gamer I just click a lot.
customer_reviews.text: I do not game but when I use a computer I click in what I would consider a pretty extreme manner. This mousepad has never let me down, no matter how hard I press or how fast I drag something to the recycle bin like the trash it is. It's kind of like winning a game if that game is keeping a clean desktop.
customer_reviews.author: buyerofthings

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good -- but is a little sharp on the edges
customer_reviews.text: I use this product with my desktop computer. I find that the edges of the mousepad are a little sharp for my comfort but it is not too bad overall. I havne't been cut or anything, but if you're planning on using your computer for hours on end (I use mine in about 4 hr spurts and it seems fine for that) it might be best to spend a little extra money to get a more quality mousepad. The tracking surfaces is nice and I've had no issues with wear.
customer_reviews.author: Trace Maurer

customer_reviews.title: It's huge
customer_reviews.text: I didn't pay attention to the dimensions of this mouse pad. It's huge. Perhaps "gaming" in the title should've been a clue but I didn't realize that gaming mouse pads are that large. Doesn't quite fit on my desk. So if you're looking for a regular desk mouse pad, check the dimensions first. Otherwise, it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Erratic cursor behavior from mice on this pad.
customer_reviews.text: Decent size and feels fine, but whenever I drag either of my mice across it the cursor jumps around erratically like it's detecting side to side movement as it cross the pad. I don't have this issue when using the mice on other surfaces(e.g., my desk, pant leg, etc). Due to this it's quite unusable for me as a pad to play games on when I'm on work trips. Maybe mine was just a fluke, but I'll stick to the name brand pads after this.
customer_reviews.author: zomgyeti

customer_reviews.title: No frill mouse pad that does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Every gamer needs a mouse pad, and this was perfectly priced and sized for what I needed. Everyone is going to need something different but, at this price, I couldn't pass it up. The mouse pad sits on my desk and does what a mouse pad is supposed to do - be a pad for my mouse. I do find that it moves around a little more than I'd like it to, but because of the nice big size, I never find it an issue to adjust it. More of an annoyance for me than an actual problem in the product. You should feel confident in making this jump if you're looking for a no frills mouse pad.
customer_reviews.author: Prince Family

customer_reviews.title: Woot!
customer_reviews.text: It's literally like a square foot of mouse pad. I couldn't help but laugh when I opened the package because I was expecting a run of the mill regular sized mouse pad, the kind you always see. And then.... Behold! Unsheathing this from big box it was rolled up inside made me feel like I was opening a gag gift with clown shoes or something of the sort. That being said, it functions perfectly well. So, I cut it up into pieces and now have multiple mouse pads for the price of one. Woot!
customer_reviews.author: Yupup

customer_reviews.title: Great coverage area - about 12.5" x 11.5", thin and perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have two computers side by side. One for work and one for video editing. This pad is perfect for video editing because you can scroll all over the place with the mouse and never run out of real estate. Thin and nimble too, not the old school fat and chunky pad that gets huge dents and holes. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: eng_steve

customer_reviews.title: My gaming mouse sticks to the surface of this pad
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Corsair gaming mice, one about 2 years old and the other brand new. They both feel like they stick to t he surface instead of gliding smoothly over it. The Corsair mouse software identifies the surface as a low quality. My old much smaller mouse pad registered much higher and it is a generic mouse pad from a department store.
customer_reviews.author: AudiGuy

customer_reviews.title: The cloth covering begins to peel off the rubber backing after a few days of use.
customer_reviews.text: The pad is soft and lies flat but the constant rubbing of your hand on the black covering causes the pad to get dirty from your dead skin cells and oils from your hand...not to mention whatever you may be snacking on. I have began to rotate the pad to a different side (edge) because of the peeling of the soft cover. It is not a good gaming mouse pad.
customer_reviews.author: Bullitt

customer_reviews.title: Good price for quality
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know what to expect in terms of finding best mouse pad. Honestly it seems like the most important thing for mouse pad is not slippery. This one is not slippery and it good price. So it deserves 4 in my book. Dimensions are good and it definitely has enough if not more space than what you need.
customer_reviews.author: Emre Gokce

customer_reviews.title: Excellent: Thin, portable...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Thin. The texture allows for mice lasers or ball to accurately track. It can be rolled up for portability. And washed pretty easy too (I hand wash mine and it drys pretty quick). Cons: Gets dirty easy and shows it (I have the black mouse pad). Don't snack around this thing or else... that random crumb will find a home on the pad.
customer_reviews.author: Brock

customer_reviews.title: Quality as expected. Works well!
customer_reviews.text: Needed new mousepad and this amazon basics one was one of the most cost efficient and will match my other amazon basics gear (keyboard, cables, etc). As with all other amazon basics items I have ordered it looks and functions as something that is twice as expensive. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Di W.

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: The edge feels like it cuts the heel of my hand sometimes. It is not precise enough for the most basic of games (think bloon tower defense). A real gamer would hate it. For basic computer use, it's ok. At times it's hard to get the cursor where I want it when editing in Word. I use a laser mouse.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Durable & serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: A mouse pad, a pad for a mouse. What a wonderful thing. Like the wheels to a car or Batman to Robin, every mouse needs its pad.
customer_reviews.author: Zack G.

customer_reviews.title: Not quite premium but nice!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value. I bought this as a replacement for my now very worn steelseries mouse pad. It doesn't have the same traction and cushy feel but overall satisfied. BTW, this thing is huge. Yeah, like, I read the dimensions and logically comprehended the values but it's different once you get it home and put it on your desk.
customer_reviews.author: Vas B.

customer_reviews.title: Basic mousepad
customer_reviews.text: It is as described, a basic mousepad. Although basic, it's very functional. The bottom is nonslip and the mousepad itself is fairly large. It covers a lot of space and gives plenty of room to move around. I'm not using it for gaming, just normal use, but it's more than enough. overall, great item and price.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: It attracts dust like a magnet. It is very large and I love it.I have never hit the edge while gaming. Inexpensive and durable. If you are looking for a mouse pad look no further than here. (Mouse NOT included)
customer_reviews.author: J. Goff

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size, good design, but prone to collecting hair
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wireless iMac mouse / desktop computer. I don't game, but I wanted a mouse pad that was large enough to be able to move the mouse from one corner of the screen to another in one swipe. This one is a perfect size. It's simply designed, which I love. Only con is that it is a hair / dust magnet! I just fold it up and tuck it under the monitor when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: cab13

customer_reviews.title: Sharp edges
customer_reviews.text: I'm usually a big fan of amazonbasics products. Not this one. I was looking for a simple pad for my magic mouse since it was scratching my wood table. This pad works but the edge of the pad is very sharp. I also have three monitors and go right and left very often. After using it for a few minutes my wrists were scratched up. It is very uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Peter P.

customer_reviews.title: It's a mouse pad.
customer_reviews.text: This is a mouse pad. And it does what mouse pads do. Not much good or bad about it. It simply is.
customer_reviews.author: nkh004

customer_reviews.title: Edges are uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: The pad is a great large size, and it's nice that it's so thin if that's what you're looking for. This would have been a 5 star review from me instead of a 3 star - but the main issue I have is that the edges of it are rough and uncomfortable. If you are in a position where your wrist or arm is in constant contact with the edge or outside it doesn't take long to see what I mean. I ended up with lines on my arm and even once a scratch on my wrist. I generally order more expensive mouse pads with smooth sewn edges, guess I will go back to that!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Holland

customer_reviews.title: Huge Mousepad
customer_reviews.text: This mousepad is huge! I didn't realize that when purchased for my work station that is on a tray so small space for a sit stand desk. It's the same as average mousepads in thickness and works fine once I rolled it over the edge of the tray it hasn't shifted at all so I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Darkesroh

customer_reviews.title: Great "budget" mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: The mouse pad is great for a "budget" or if you want a no thrills mouse pad. The material is good quality and is easy to clean with canned air (cat hair rich environment). Tracks well and has no issues with high speed movement. Would recommend to anyone looking for something "entry level" or that doesn't care about fancy features.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Dupree

customer_reviews.title: Highly Reccomend
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure what I was getting when I ordered this item, but when I first received it I fell in love. The quality, size, and material is exactly what you want in a gaming mouse pad. This product might not look flashy with lights, but this mouse pad is completely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: AnAngryOwl

customer_reviews.title: Great for basics
customer_reviews.text: I use it for work, not a lot of use, but it has slipped a couple of times while I was moving. Not sure I would use it for gaming because of this, though I use it on a glass surface so that may be some of it. Works good though, mouse always reads on it. Great for what I needed, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Peterson

customer_reviews.title: As described!
customer_reviews.text: As described! I ordered the "Mini" which to me is more of an average sized? But then again, I guess I'm not much of a mouse-pad connoisseur! Its thin, in a good way, and the bottom is grippy so it doesn't move.
customer_reviews.author: JenniferLynn

customer_reviews.title: Spacious--Yes. Useful? For Some, Yes.
customer_reviews.text: This product was too big for my needs, so I applied for a refund. From what I saw, when I took the roll out of its wrapper, it is a thin piece of rubber, which would likely work well for its intended purpose. Or it might serve as a doormat! I suggest that Amazon pare this back to something like 10" x 12" for those of us with limited space.
customer_reviews.author: Mohabee Serrano

customer_reviews.title: Poor choice for a mouse pad...
customer_reviews.text: Okay for an inexpensive mouse pad on the "cheap"... but difficult to keep it clean and the top surface becomes rather "nappy" way too quick. At least you can literally toss in the washing machine with your laundry to clean it. I have since replaced it with a superior hard surface mouse pad as made by 3M that I purchased from Amazon recently.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: Do not machine wash
customer_reviews.text: Overall great mouse pad that holds up well. Description says it is machine washable. It did great in the washer and cane out clean. However, once it air dryer the sides curled upwards. I would not recommend using a washer or getting the pad soaking wet. A damp cloth and hand washing may be better.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse pad I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had known about this much sooner. The extra area means less need to lift & reposition the mouse. Pad is thin (good thing) and stays put on my desktop. Nice tracking surface. I truly like everything about this mouse pad. Oh, and the price was great too.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: Great so far. It came rolled up in a rectangular box. Unrolls nice flat but will need a little time to settle. Works and feels as good as other more expensive name brand pads. I would (and probably will) buy it again if I ever need another but I suspect it will last for some time.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: i wanted a bigger mouse pad and amazon basics caught my eye with the gaming series by amazonbasics of course it works well and at a good price but it does tend to get dirty easily im not sure how to clean it but i have no other problems with it as it works well even if it does get dirty easily if you want quality with a good price this just might be the mouse pad you are looking for
customer_reviews.author: NoteCreations A

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as review suggests
customer_reviews.text: I bought based on such high reviews. It's not very good. I used it with mac book air and apple mouse. You really have to try many times to get to the point you want on screen. In fact, if you flip it, back side works better but then other side is so smooth that whole pad slides on table top especially glass table.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, Good Size Selection Available, Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these in mini size for laptops and 1 in the Extended size for a gaming desktop PC. All have a smooth fabric covering that allows the mouse to easily glide. The fabric edges aren't surged or sealed. They feature a nonslip backing that holds the mouse pad in place. They are quite thin but we appreciate the thinness as it doesn't interfere with wrist placement or comfort. Very pleased with all products. Would order again.
customer_reviews.author: Denver's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Nice and soft. Can roll up to put into my laptop pouch and then instantly go flat on the table without any creasing or bending. The neoprene makes for super mouse movement, and just a few flicks to get rid of any dust or crumbs so cleaning is a breeze. Will be buying a few more for the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Eager2Learn

customer_reviews.title: No need to pay a premium for other name brand mouse pads. This does the same thing at a lower price point.
customer_reviews.text: Good size and price compared to other name brand mouse pads. Coming from a steel series it does the same job. My small complaint is that the edges feel sharp. When you're using low dpi and have to drag your forearm around it can get scratched. Sometimes its noticeable other times its not. I think over time it will smooth out.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for it's price
customer_reviews.text: This is my first full desk mouse pad, and I love it. Means I don't have to worry about rolling off my mouse pad, and It add's a nice top to my crappy desk. I would love if it were a little thicker, but for what you're paying, this is more than enough.
customer_reviews.author: Zev Levit-Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Wears/gets dirt too easily.
customer_reviews.text: It's a generally alright product, but it gets dirt too easily. After a small amount of time, the sides fray/come part from the bottom part that goes on the desk. It's not really disappointing, it's just a light inconvenience. If you don't want to spend more money on a higher quality one, settle for this one, as it's huge and good for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: EliteReviewsUSA

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality and cheap. Not much else to ask for. I see the complaints about smell but I didn’t smell a thing...? I’ve heard that the smell is not as bad as other products out there and goes away anyhow. It comes in a rectangular box rolled up, ready to use. I ordered the Standard Size one and I’m impressed with the size. Standard is more than enough for your regular everyday desktop use. I game with this mousepad (as it is advertised) and am completely satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Emanuel

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This pad is absolutely perfect for my desk. I didn't necessarily buy it for gaming purposes (though I dabble a smidge). I needed something that didn't take up a whole lot of space and this fills that need. It's ultimately for universal usage and it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Paolillo

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be Exact Clone of Steel Series Mouse Pad
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Amazon Essential mousepad because my Steel Series mouse pad of the same size was getting worn and dirty. This Amazon mousepad is the exact same size and appears to be an exact replica of the Steel Series pad, only less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Allen

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work well on its own
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse pad as my mouse was not working well due to my desk becoming too shiny after months and years of use and cleaning. I found that, even when using the mouse pad, when I moved the mouse over the shiny part of the desk the pointer still moved slowly and erratically. I taped a sheet of paper to the desk underneath the mouse pad and it works fine now, but you shouldn't have to do that!
customer_reviews.author: Mike R

customer_reviews.title: Anything small enough will get stuck into the pad
customer_reviews.text: Not comfortable to place your wrist on as it is very thin and the material at bottom does not stay in place sometimes. Pad material at top is cheap because it gets dirty very easy and is not easy to clean. Anything small enough will stick in the top of pad making it impossible to get out.
customer_reviews.author: Suzie McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Works for me.
customer_reviews.text: To be fair I did not buy this for gaming. I needed a large mat for my work desk that was a black background. This has held up nice and is easy to clean. I assume it would work well for gaming as well. I have used my mouse on it and it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: EPD073
